intro: Parinari gabunensis, commonly known as Gabon parinari, is a tropical tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible, fleshy berries that are yellow when ripe. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. The species is valued for its timber and has some traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
